name: NSTouch
desc: A snapshot of a particular touch at an instant in time.

items.name: var type: NSTouch.TouchType
items.desc: A type of touch from a Touch Bar interaction.

items.name: enum NSTouch.TouchType
items.desc: A bit mask identifying a direct or indirect touch type.

items.name: struct NSTouch.TouchTypeMask
items.desc: A bit mask identifying a direct or indirect touch type.

items.name: var identity: NSCopying & NSObjectProtocol
items.desc: The changes to a particular touch during its lifetime.

items.name: var phase: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: The current phase of the touch.

items.name: struct NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: The possible phases of a touch.

items.name: var normalizedPosition: NSPoint
items.desc: The normalized position of the touch.

items.name: var isResting: Bool
items.desc: The indicator for a resting touch.

items.name: var device: Any?
items.desc: The digitizer that generates the touch. Useful to distinguish touches emanating from multiple-device scenarios.

items.name: var deviceSize: NSSize
items.desc: The range of the touch device in points, such as 72 ppi.

items.name: func location(in: NSView?) -> NSPoint
items.desc: Indicates the location of the touch in the view's coordinates.

items.name: func previousLocation(in: NSView?) -> NSPoint
items.desc: Indicates the previous location of the touch in the view's coordinates.
